item.title: Choosing Functional Python (Without Forcing It)
item.description: Why this matters Python gives you multiple ways to solve the same problem. Loops, comprehensions, generators, map, filter, reduce, any, sorted, and more. For a long time, I knew these tools existed, but I didn’t really know when or why to use them. I could read functional-style code, but writing it confidently was another story. This document is not a tutorial on functional programming in Python. It’s a set of notes, patterns, and mental models that helped things finally click for me.
